answerText: Porifera [10] Members of the phylum porifera usually cannot move. Thus, they are described by this term, which is the opposite of motile.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Penn | 16 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Its class Hexactinellida includes the Venus Flower basket and other organisms that have 6-pointed spicules. For 10 points each: [10] Name this phylum whose organisms' bodies contain a central mesohyl between two layers of cells. These filter-feeders are more commonly known as sponges.
